search_results.title: Quinidine - Wikipedia
search_results.snippet: Quinidine is a class IA antiarrhythmic agent used to treat heart rhythm disturbances. [1] It is a diastereomer of antimalarial agent quinine.

search_results.title: Quinidine tablets - Cleveland Clinic

search_results.title: Quinidine: Uses, Side Effects, Dosage & Reviews - GoodRx
search_results.snippet: Quinidine is an antiarrhythmic. It works by blocking sodium channels, which play a major part in your heart's electrical activity.
